org.jpws.pwslib.order

Class OrderedRecordList

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.order.OrderedRecordList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PwsFileListener

    public class OrderedRecordList
extends java.lang.Object
implements PwsFileListener
    Represents an ordered list of DefaultRecordWrapper objects which may (or may not) belong to a specific, singular PwsRecordList. List altering actions, like insertion and removal of records or loading of a database, preserve the order of the list. Record-wrappers may be addressed by their index numbers in the list.

    The design of this class is to function as a "middleware" between a record database object and any record aware data model which requires reference to a sorted order of items. The OrderedRecordList listens to modification events of the underlying database and transforms them into events of the sorted list. This class may, however, also be used for simpler (or likewise more complex) purposes of sorting records as the bondage to a database is not mandatory and record wrappers can be added and removed from the list directly.

    The sorting follows a fixed combination of values, namely GROUP + TITLE. Sorting follows the Collator class to guarantee locale sensitive sorting success.

    This class issues events for OrderedListListeners to reflect list modifications. At the same time this class is a PwsFileListener and - if records were loaded from a Pws record list - it listens to modifications of this database and aligns elements of the list accordingly. This design allows to update even complex display component arrangements by simply modifying the underlying record database.

    A facility for list filtering is available. The user has to set up a class to implement the RecordSelector interface where acceptance of records is defined. The selector is activated through method setRecordSelector(); for each updated selection criterion refresh() or reload() must be called to recreate the list content.

      • sortedSet

        protected java.util.SortedSet<DefaultRecordWrapper> sortedSet
        Sorted Set structure to hold DefaultRecordWrapper objects representing the content of this record list in a sorted fashion. WARNING! - DefaultRecordWrapper does not comply to the Set requirements. Element containment cannot be researched correctly in this set!

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrderedRecordList

        public OrderedRecordList()
        Constructor for an ordered record list without database bondage for the current default locale.

      • OrderedRecordList

        public OrderedRecordList(java.util.Locale locale)
        Constructor for an ordered record list without database bondage for the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - activated locale for sorting

      • OrderedRecordList

        public OrderedRecordList(PwsRecordList f)
        Constructor for an ordered record list which is related to a PwsRecordList object. The current VM default locale is used for sorting records.

        Note: In order to load data from and listen to the record list the method loadDatabase() must be called once. The constructor however determines database bondage of this object.

        Parameters:
        f - the PwsRecordList to which the records of this odered list must belong

      • OrderedRecordList

        public OrderedRecordList(PwsRecordList f,
                         java.util.Locale locale)
        Constructor for an ordered record list which is related to a PwsRecordList object and which is sorted after the specified locale.

        Note: In order to load data from and listen to a record list the method loadDatabase() must be called once. The constructor however determines database bondage of this object.

        Parameters:
        f - the PwsRecordList to which the records of this odered list must belong
        locale - activated locale for sorting

    • Method Detail

      • verifyBondage

        protected void verifyBondage(DefaultRecordWrapper wrap)
        Tests if the parameter record complies with database bondage of this list. In case of non-compliance an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        wrap - DefaultRecordWrapper record to be evaluated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - ("unrelated record") if bondage violation

      • updateItem

        public void updateItem(DefaultRecordWrapper record)
        Updates the given record in this list and in the filtered index. The record must be an element of this list, otherwise an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        record - DefaultRecordWrapper

      • insertItem

        public void insertItem(DefaultRecordWrapper record)
        Inserts an element into this list. If this list is bound to a PwsRecordList, the given record must be an element of it. Whether the inserted item appears in the current filtered index, and thus issues an insertion event, depends on the filter settings (if there are any).

        WARNING!! Applying this when this list has bondage may lead to de-synchronisation of list and database. This method does not insert a record into the database!

        Parameters:
        record - DefaultRecordWrapper record to be inserted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the record fails to conform

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<DefaultRecordWrapper> iterator()
        Detached iterator over all elements in the filtered index of this list. Iteration follows the sequential sorting of this list and allows concurrent list modifications (which are not reflected into the traversed set).
        Returns:
        Iterator<DefaultRecordWrapper>

      • elementIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<DefaultRecordWrapper> elementIterator()
        Detached iterator over all elements in this list. This iterator allows concurrent list modifications (which are not reflected into the traversed set).
        Returns:
        Iterator<DefaultRecordWrapper>

      • insertRecordIndex

        protected void insertRecordIndex(DefaultRecordWrapper wrap,
                                 int index)
        Inserts a record into the sorted and filtered index and issues a OrderedListEvent. This does not verify bondage.
        Parameters:
        wrap - DefaultRecordWrapper record representation
        index - int index position in filtered list

      • loadDatabase

        public void loadDatabase(PwsRecordList rlist,
                         long expireScope)
        Loads a list of PwsRecords from a PwsRecordList object by discarding any previous content. If this object is bound to a PwsFile, the parameter list must also be a PwsFile and have an identical resource file (persistent file). If this object is not bound to a database, this method does, however, not lead to bondage, regardless of the instance type of list.

        This method makes this object listen to the parameter record list for content change events.

        Parameters:
        rlist - database to be loaded
        expireScope - time period in milliseconds for expire-soon status of record wrappers; 0 for ignore
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter does not fit the bound dbf

      • reindex

        protected void reindex()
        Recreates the filtered list index according to current filter settings provided by the user (setRecordSelector()).

      • refreshFilter

        public void refreshFilter()
        Refreshes the filtered list index according to current filter settings, if they were provided by the user. This issues an OrderedListEvent.

        Note: This has to be performed when a filtering agent has been modified which was added by the user through setRecordSelector().

      • pushSortField

        public void pushSortField(DefaultRecordWrapper.SortField sort)
        Pushes the given sort field into the hierarchy of the three sort values at 'primary' position. This resorts and re-indexes with a LIST_RELOADED event. The field may be a duplicate of any currently set sort field, the resulting field order is, however, free of duplicates.
        Parameters:
        sort - SortField

      • setSortDirection

        public void setSortDirection(int direction)
        Sets the sorting direction, either ASCENDING or DESCENDING. Default value is ASCENDING.
        Parameters:
        direction - int

      • getSortDirection

        public int getSortDirection()
        Returns the sorting direction, either ASCENDING or DESCENDING. Default value is ASCENDING.
        Returns:
        direction int

      • setSorting

        public void setSorting(DefaultRecordWrapper.SortField[] sort)
        Sets the sorting order for this record list by an array of minimum three sort fields. The used indexes are: 0 = primary, 1 = secondary, 2 = tertiary. The primary field is mandatory, others can be null provided its successor is also null. There must not appear duplicate field settings. This resorts and re-indexes with a LIST_RELOADED event unless the given sort field sequence does not modify the already in place sorting, in which case no activity occurs.
        Parameters:
        sort - SortField[] array of 3 sort field values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter was inconsistent
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • setSorting

        public void setSorting(DefaultRecordWrapper.SortField primary,
                       DefaultRecordWrapper.SortField secondary,
                       DefaultRecordWrapper.SortField tertiary)
        Sets the sorting order for this record list. The primary field is mandatory, others can be null provided its successor is also null. There must not appear duplicate field settings. This resorts and re-indexes with a LIST_RELOADED event unless the given sort field sequence does not modify the already in place sorting, in which case no activity occurs.
        Parameters:
        primary - SortField first ranking sort value
        secondary - SortField second ranking sort value
        tertiary - SortField third ranking sort value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a parameter value was set falsely

      • getSorting

        public DefaultRecordWrapper.SortField[] getSorting()
        Returns an array of 3 SortField values comprising current settings of this list for primary (0), secondary (1) and tertiary (2) sort fields.
        Returns:
        SortField[]

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reloads and resorts this list's content from the record list which was last loaded by use of loadDatabase(). This is an expensive operation and will issue a LIST_RELOADED event. Does nothing if there was no list previously loaded.

      • acceptEntry

        protected boolean acceptEntry(DefaultRecordWrapper rec)
        Performs the filtering criterion for this list based on a PwsRecord value. In OrderedRecordList this refers to a RecordSelector which can be supplied by the user through setRecordSelector(). By overriding this method in a subclass, the user could organise a filter criterion in an alternate way.
        Parameters:
        rec - DefaultRecordWrapper a entry candidate for this list
        Returns:
        true if this candidate has to be included into this list

      • makeRecordWrapper

        public DefaultRecordWrapper makeRecordWrapper(PwsRecord rec,
                                              java.util.Locale locale)
        The default function used by this class to create wrappers for records. May be overridden by user applications to supply a specific record wrapper type (which must be a subclass of DefaultRecordWrapper).
        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord
        locale - Locale
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper containing the argument record
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if rec is null

        The number of elements in the filtered list index.

        public int totalSize()
        The number of elements in this list.

        public DefaultRecordWrapper getItemAt(int index)

        Parameters:
        index - int
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper if index is in defined range, or null otherwise

      • getGroup

        public DefaultRecordWrapper[] getGroup(java.lang.String group,
                                       boolean exact)
        Returns the subset of records from the filtered index which contain the specified GROUP value.
        Parameters:
        group - String selective group value; if null an empty array is returned
        exact - boolean whether select value must be a complete existing group name
        Returns:
        array of DefaultRecordWrapper

      • getLocale

        public final java.util.Locale getLocale()
        Returns the active locale used to collate sortvalues of this list.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(PwsRecord rec)
        Returns the current index position of the parameter record in the filtered index.
        Parameters:
        rec - the PwsRecord to be searched
        Returns:
        index position or -1 if the record is not in the filtered list

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(DefaultRecordWrapper rec)
        Returns the current index position of the parameter record in the filtered index.
        Parameters:
        rec - DefaultRecordWrapper the record to be searched; may be null
        Returns:
        index position or -1 if the record is not in the filtered list

      • sortIndexOf

        protected int sortIndexOf(DefaultRecordWrapper rec)
        Returns the sort index position of the parameter record if it were inserted into it. This does not require the parameter to be element of this list or the filtered index. However, if the record cannot be element of the index, e.g. due to filtering restrictions, -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        rec - DefaultRecordWrapper the record to be sorted; may be null
        Returns:
        index position or -1 if the parameter was null or not in the filtered index

      • removeItemIndex

        protected void removeItemIndex(int index)
        Removes the element at a specified index position from the filtering index and issues an ordered list event. Does not remove the record from this list!. Does nothing if given index position is out of range.

        WARNING!! Applying this method when this list has bondage may lead to de-synchronisation of list and database. This method does not remove a record from the database!

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(DefaultRecordWrapper wrap)
        Removes the specified record from this list. If the record was shown in the current filtered index, a remove event is fired.

        WARNING!! Applying this method when this list has bondage may lead to de-synchronisation of list and database. This method does not remove a record from the linked database!

        Parameters:
        wrap - DefaultRecordWrapper record to remove; may be null

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements from this list.

      • clearIntern

        protected void clearIntern()
        Removes all elements from this list without issuing a list event.

      • setExpireScope

        public void setExpireScope(long time)
        Sets the time scope for which level EXPIRE_SOON of wrapper records EXPIRY status is set. This method recalculates the status of all records; the start time of the scope is the actual system time.
        Parameters:
        time - time period in milliseconds

      • setRecordSelector

        public void setRecordSelector(OrderedRecordList.RecordSelector selector)
        Sets the record selector to be active as filter criterion for this ordered record list. By default this value is null and permits all records. refresh() - preferrably - or reload() can be performed in order to rebuild the index when the filter criterion has been modified.
        Parameters:
        selector - RecordSelector, may be null

      • addOrderedListListener

        public void addOrderedListListener(OrderedListListener lis)
        Adds a listener to the OrderedListEvents that this list is issuing.
        Parameters:
        lis - OrderedListListener object

      • removeOrderedListListener

        public void removeOrderedListListener(OrderedListListener listener)
        Removes the given OrderedListListener from this list.
        Parameters:
        listener - OrderedListListener

      • getListeners

        protected void fireOrderedListEvent(int type,
                                    int index,
                                    DefaultRecordWrapper rec)

      • printout

        public void printout(java.io.PrintStream out)
        Test function printing the content of the ordered list in the sorted order. (The resulting line per record is index-nr, sort-value and record-id.)
        Parameters:
        out - PrintStream
